org.gradoop.flink.io.impl.csv.indexed.functions

Class MultipleFileOutputFormat<IT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.io.impl.csv.indexed.functions.MultipleFileOutputFormat<IT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IT - The type of the records to write.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.apache.flink.api.common.io.CleanupWhenUnsuccessful, org.apache.flink.api.common.io.InitializeOnMaster, org.apache.flink.api.common.io.OutputFormat<IT>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IndexedCSVFileFormat

    public abstract class MultipleFileOutputFormat<IT>
extends Object
implements org.apache.flink.api.common.io.OutputFormat<IT>, org.apache.flink.api.common.io.CleanupWhenUnsuccessful, org.apache.flink.api.common.io.InitializeOnMaster
    The abstract base class for all output formats using multiple files. This format will (for each record to write) determine a subdirectory, create a new OutputFormat for that directory and write the record using the newly created format. Those formats will be created as soon as the first record is to be written to that directory and they will not be initialized automatically.
    Warning: The configure(Configuration), open(int, int), close() and initializeGlobal(int) methods will not invoke the respective methods of the new output formats, their parameters will just be stored as configuration, taskNumber, numTasks, parallelism respectively. Make sure to configure each output format in createFormatForDirectory(Path).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createFormatForDirectory

        protected abstract org.apache.flink.api.common.io.OutputFormat<IT> createFormatForDirectory(org.apache.flink.core.fs.Path directory)
                                                                                     throws IOException
        Create or load an OutputFormat to use for a specific directory. The directory should be a subdirectory of the root directory of this output format.
        Parameters:
        directory - The (sub-)directory where the output format operates.
        Returns:
        The output format used to write in that directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - when the initialization of the new format fails.

      • getDirectoryForRecord

        protected abstract String getDirectoryForRecord(IT record)
        Get the appropriate subdirectory for a record. This is expected to return a relative path from the root directory.
        Parameters:
        record - The record to write.
        Returns:
        The output directory to store the record in.
